intro: Phippsiomeles guerreris, commonly known as the Guerreran mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as ceiba and mahogany. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often inconspicuous. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its specialized ecological role, it plays an important part in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
